content.description:
The problem is on the same boulder as

The Cave

route (V2-).

Start in the same position underneath. When you're coming out of the cave, dyno from a positive hold to the top sloper. It is kind of a big move, but it is fun.
content.location: It is at the Cave boulder.

content.description: Sit start inside the shallow cave on a flake.  Move left and exit the cave and follow the jugs up and right to a large sloper.  Slap over the top and walk off.
content.location:
It is uphill and left of

Easy Flake

by ~30 feet.

content.description:
Randall Chapman's guidebook describes a V6 traverse of the Cave Boulder. I was unable to find/figure that out, but near where it is supposed to be is this OK up problem, starting just left of the popular

The Cave

and

The Evac

routes. The crux is getting off the ground. Start with your left hand on a sloping crimp near a blunt arete, and your right hand in a round dish in the more concave area of the boulder. Move up toward the lip of the boulder, and top out. It's a one move wonder.
content.location:
It's in the large, round, brown, varnished scoop/concavity about 5-6' left of

The Cave

and

The Evac

routes.
